Headline: The Korean Stone Art Museum: Seoul’s Gateway to the Past
Article_Body:
The Korean Stone Art Museum is full of faces from the past. They are carved into ancient stone sculptures that are considered sacred. They hold wishes and spirits, according to Yeonkyung Joo, dean of the museum’s department of liberal arts and sciences. No visit to this museum in Seoul, South Korea, is complete without a stroll through the outdoor exhibition garden. It is where beautiful relics commune with nature.

This Great Big Story was inspired by Genesis.
